greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=2; if n = Product p_i^e_i, n > 1, then a(n) = Product p_{i+1}^e_i.
reference: From a puzzle proposed by _Marc LeBrun_.
link: Indranil Ghosh, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1, 10000
maple: succfactorization := proc(n) local p,d; if(1 = n) then RETURN(2); fi; p := 1; for d in ifactors(n)[ 2 ] do p := p * (nextprime(d[ 1 ])^d[ 2 ]); od; RETURN(p); end;
mathematica: a[1] = 2; a[p_?PrimeQ] := a[p] = Prime[PrimePi[p] + 1]; a[n_] := a[n] = Times @@ (a[First[#]]^Last[#] &) /@ FactorInteger[n]; Table[ a[n], {n, 1, 65}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 18 2013 *)
program: a045965 n = if n == 1 then 2 else a003961 n
from sympy import factorint, primepi, prime, prod
return 2 if n==1 else prod(prime(primepi(i) + 1)**f[i] for i in f) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 15 2017
(PARI) a(n) = if (n==1, 2, my(f=factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = nextprime(f[i,1]+1)); factorback(f)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 18 2020
xref: Cf. A048673. Essentially identical to A003961.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
